titleStmt.title: A brief narrative, or, The remonstrance of John Kersey, sometimes chief clerk of the Trinity-House of Deptford-Strond in the county of Kent with his just right to the said office truly represented ; also, the cause of his dismission in the year 1648, by the usurped power then governing ; with his several addresses to the corporation, since His Majesties happy restauration, but no re-admission.

A brief narrative, or, The remonstrance of John Kersey, sometimes chief clerk of the Trinity-House of Deptford-Strond in the county of Kent with his just right to the said office truly represented ; also, the cause of his dismission in the year 1648, by the usurped power then governing ; with his several addresses to the corporation, since His Majesties happy restauration, but no re-admission.

notesStmt.note: N.B. The "Mr. Peapes" referred to on p. 13 is John Pepys (1641-1677), younger brother of Samuel Pepys (1633-1703), the diarist, who obtained the post for John Pepys. Cf. DNB, v. 15, p. 808.
Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
